summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the arctangent, in radians, of the quotient of two numbers

title: BIGINT data type
summary: The BIGINT data type provides 8 bytes of storage for integer values.

summary: Built-in SQL function that converts input to a 64-bit integer representation

title: BLOB data type
summary: The BLOB (binary large object) data type is used for varying-length binary strings that can be up to 2,147,483,647 characters long.

title: BOOLEAN data type
summary: The BOOLEAN data type provides 1 byte of storage for logical values.

summary: Syntax for and examples of Boolean expressions in Splice Machine SQL.

summary: Calls a stored procedure.

summary: Built-in system procedure that cancels a specific backup.

summary: Built-in system procedure that cancels a specific backup.

title: CASE Expression
summary: Syntax for and examples of CASE expressions in Splice Machine SQL.

title: CAST built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that converts values (expressions) from one data type to another

title: CEIL built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the smallest integer greater than or equal to a specified numeric value

title: CHAR built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that returns a fixed-length character string representation.

title: CHAR data type
summary: The CHAR data type provides for fixed-length storage of strings.

title: CLOB data type
summary: The CLOB (character large object) data type is used for varying-length character strings that can be up to 2,147,483,647 characters long.

title: Analyze command
summary: Collects statistics for a table or schema.

title: Autocommit command
summary: Turns the connection's auto-commit mode on or off.

title: Commit command
summary: Commits the currently active transaction and initiates a new transaction.

title: Connect command
summary: Connect to a database via its URL.

title: Describe command
summary: Displays a description of a table or view.

title: Disconnect command
summary: Disconnects from a database.

title: ElapsedTime command
summary: Enables or disables display of elapsed time for command execution.

title: Execute command
summary: Executes an SQL prepared statement or SQL command string.

title: Exit command
summary: Causes the command line interface to exit.

title: Explain Plan command
summary: Displays the execution plan for an SQL statement.

title: Export command
summary: Exports query results to CSV files.

title: Help command
summary: Displays a list of the available commands.

title: Command Line Commands Summary
summary: Summarizes the splice> commands.

title: Command Line Syntax
summary: Syntax rules and helpful information for using the Splice Machine splice> command line interpreter.

title: MaximumDisplayWidth command
summary: Sets the maximum displayed width for each column of results displayed by the command line interpreter.

title: Prepare command
summary: Creates a prepared statement for use by other commands.

title: Release Savepoint command
summary: Releases a savepoint.

title: Remove command
summary: Removes a previously prepared statement.

title: Rollback command
summary: Rolls back the currently active transaction and initiates a new transaction.

title: Rollback to Savepoint command
summary: Rolls the current transaction back to the specified savepoint.

title: Run command
summary: Runs commands from a file.

title: Savepoint command
summary: Creates a savepoint within the current transaction.

title: Set Connection command
summary: Allows you to specify which connection is the current connection

title: Show Connections command
summary: Displays information about active connections and database objects.

title: Show Functions command
summary: Displays information about functions defined in the database or in a schema.

title: Show Indexes command
summary: Displays information about the indexes defined on a table, a database, or a schema.

title: Show PrimaryKeys command
summary: Displays information about the primary keys in a table.

title: Show Procedures command
summary: Displays information about the procedures that have created in a database.

title: Show Roles command
summary: Displays information about all of the roles defined in the database.

title: Show Schemas command
summary: Displays information about the schemas in the current connection.

title: Show Synonyms command
summary: Displays information about the synonyms that have been created in a database or schema.

title: Show Tables command
summary: Displays all of the tables in a database or schema.

title: Show Views command
summary: Displays information about all of the views in a schema.

title: COALESCE built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that returns its first non-null argument. VALUE is a synonym for COALESCE in Splice Machine.

summary: How to configure a Cognos connection to Splice Machine

title: SYSCS_UTIL.COLLECT_SCHEMA_STATISTICS built-in system procedure
summary: Built-in system procedure that collects statistics on a schema.

title: Simple-column-Name
summary: Used in statements to specify the definition of a column.

title: SYSCS_UTIL.COMPUTE_SPLIT_KEY built-in system procedure
summary: Built-in system procedure that computes the split keys for a table or index, prior to using the BULK_IMPORT_HFILE procedure to import data from HFiles.

title: Concatenation operator (||)
summary: Built-in SQL function that concatenates one character or bit string expression onto another.

summary: Walks you configuring an AWS S3 bucket for use with Splice Machine.

summary: Introduction to using the Splice Machine connection commands.

summary: Summarizes the user interface features of the Splice Machine Management console.

title: CONSTRAINT clause
summary: An optional clause in CREATE TABLE and ALTER TABLE statements that specifies a rule to which the data must conform.

title: COS built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the cosine of a number

title: COSH built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the hyperbolic cosine of a specified number

title: COT built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that returns cotangent of a number

title: COUNT built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL aggregate or window function that returns the number of rows that are returned by a query.

title: CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE statement
summary: Allows you to query data stored in a flat file as if that data were stored in a Splice Machine table.

title: CREATE FUNCTION statement
summary: Creates Java functions that you can then use in expressions.

title: CREATE INDEX statement
summary: Creates an index on a table.

title: CREATE PROCEDURE statement
summary: Creates Java stored procedures, which you can then call using the CallProcedure statement.

title: CREATE ROLE statement
summary: Creates SQL roles

title: CREATE SCHEMA statement
summary: Creates a schema in your database

title: CREATE SEQUENCE statement
summary:
Creates a sequence generator, which is
  a mechanism for generating exact numeric values, one at a time.

title: CREATE SYNONYM statement
summary:
Creates a synonym, which can provide an alternate name
for a table or a view.

title: CREATE TABLE statement
summary: Creates a new table.

title: CREATE GLOBAL TEMPORARY TABLE statement
summary: Defines a temporary table for the current connection.

title: CREATE TRIGGER statement
summary: Creates a trigger, which defines a set of actions that are executed when a database event occurs on a specified table

title: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CREATE_USER  built-in system procedure
summary: Built-in system procedure that adds a new user account to a database.

title: CREATE VIEW statement
summary: Creates a view, which is a virtual table formed by a query.

title: CROSS JOIN
summary: Join operation that roduces the Cartesian product of two tables: it produces rows that combine each row from the first table with each row from the second table.

title: CURRENT_DATE (CURRENT DATE) built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the current date

summary: Release notes for the current release of Splice Machine.

summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the authorization identifier of the current role.

title: CURRENT SCHEMA built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the schema name that is used to qualify database references not already qualified

title: CURRENT_TIME built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the current time

summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the current timestamp

summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the authorization identifier of the user who created the SQL session

summary: The DATE data type provides for storage of a year-month-day in the range supported by java.sql.Date.

summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the day part of a date

summary: Describes the parameter values you use when using debugging software with Splice Machine.

title: DECIMAL data type
summary: The  DECIMALdata type provides an exact numeric in which the precision and scale can be arbitrarily sized. You can use DECIMAL and NUMERIC interchangeably.

title: DECLARE GLOBAL TEMPORARY TABLE statement
summary: Defines a temporary table for the current connection.

summary: Built-in SQL function that converts a number from radians to degrees

summary: Deletes records from a table.

summary: Built-in system procedure that delete a specific backup.

title: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DELETE_OLD_BACKUPS built-in system procedure
summary: Built-in system procedure that deletes all backups that were created more than a certain number of days ago.

summary: Built-in SQL window function that returns the rank of a value within a partition of values defined by its OVER clause

summary: A summary of the main sections of our documentation suite.

title: DOUBLE built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that returns a floating point number

title: DOUBLE data type
summary: The DOUBLE data type provides 8-byte storage for numbers using IEEE floating-point notation. DOUBLE PRECISION can be used synonymously with DOUBLE.

title: DOUBLE PRECISION data type
summary: The DOUBLE PRECISION data type provides 8-byte storage for numbers using IEEE floating-point notation.DOUBLE can be used synonymously with DOUBLE PRECISION.

title: DROP FUNCTION statement
summary: Drops a function from a database.

title: DROP INDEX statement
summary: Drops an index from a database.

title: DROP PROCEDURE statement
summary: Drops a procedure from a database.

title: DROP ROLE statement
summary: Drops a role from a database.

title: DROP SCHEMA statement
summary: Drops a schema from a database.

title: SYSCS_UTIL.DROP_SCHEMA_STATISTICS built-in system procedure
summary: Built-in system procedure that drops statistics for a schema.

title: DROP SEQUENCE statement
summary: Drops a sequence from a database.

title: DROP SYNONYM statement
summary: Drops a synonym from a database.

title: DROP TABLE statement
summary: Drops a table from a database.

title: DROP TRIGGER statement
summary: Drops a trigger from a database.

title: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_DROP_USER built-in system procedure
summary: Built-in system procedure that removes a user account from a database.

summary: Drops a view from a database.

summary: Descriptions of using dynamic parameters in expressions in Splice Machine SQL prepared statements

title: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_EMPTY_GLOBAL_STATEMENT_CACHE built-in system procedure
summary: Built-in system procedure that removes as many compiled statements (plans) as possible from the database-wide statement cache (across all region servers).

title: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_EMPTY_STATEMENT_CACHE built-in system procedure
summary: Built-in system procedure that removes as many compiled statements (plans) as possible from the database statement cache on the current region server.

title: SYSCS_UTIL.ENABLE_COLUMN_STATISTICS built-in system procedure
summary: Built-in system procedure that enables collection of statistics on a specific column in a specific table.

summary: Built-in system procedure for upgrading from the Community Edition of Splice Machine to the Enterprise Edition of Splice Machine.

summary: Presents examples of output from using the Splice Machine Explain Plan features.

summary: Built-in SQL function that extracts information (parts) from date and time values

summary: Built-in SQL aggregate or window function that evaluates the value of an expression from the first row of a window partition.

summary: The FLOAT data type is an alias for either a REAL or DOUBLE PRECISION  data type, depending on the precision you specify.

summary: Built-in SQL function that returns  the largest integer less than or equal to a specified numeric value

summary: Describes our implementation of foreign keys and how our implementation ensures referential integrity.

summary: Describes the syntax for generated columns, the value of which is automatically incremented and assigned to each record that is created.

summary: Built-in system procedure that displays the number of active servers in the Splice cluster.

summary: Built-in system procedure that displays the derby properties.

summary: Built-in system procedure that displays summary information about the current transaction.

title: SYSCS_GET_DATABASE_PROPERTY built-in system function
summary: Built-in system function that fetches the value of the specified property of the database on the current connection.

title: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_GET_LOGGER_LEVEL built-in system procedure
summary: Built-in system procedure that displays the log level of the specified logger.

summary: Built-in system procedure that displays the names of all Splice Machine loggers in the system.

summary: Built-in system procedure that displays information about the number of RPC requests that are coming into Splice Machine.

title: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_GET_SCHEMA_INFO built-in system procedure
summary: Built-in system procedure that displays table information for all user schemas, including the HBase regions occupied and their store file size.

title: GRANT statement
summary: Gives privileges to specific user(s) or role(s) to perform actions on database objects.

title: GROUP BY clause
summary: A clause that is part of a Select Expression that groups a result into subsets that have matching values for one or more columns.

title: INITCAP built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that converts the first letter of every word to uppercase, and all remaining characters in the word to lowercase.

summary: Join operation that selects all rows from both tables as long as there is a match between the columns in both tables.

summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the index of the first occurrence of a substring within a string

title: LCASE (or LOWER) built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that converts a character expression to lowercase

title: LTRIM built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that removes blanks from the beginning of a character expression

title: LAG built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL aggregate or window function that evaluates the expression at a specified offset before the current row within a partition.

title: LAST_DAY built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the date of the last day of a month

title: LAST_VALUE built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL aggregate or window function that evaluates the value of an expression from the last row of a partition.

title: LEAD built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL aggregate or window function that evaluates the expression at a specified offset after the current row within a partition.

title: LEFT OUTER JOIN
summary: Join operation that returns all rows from the left table with the matching rows in the right table. The result is NULL in the right side when there is no match.

title: LENGTH built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that computes the length of a character or bit string expression

title: Splice Machine License Information
summary: A link to the Splice Machine license agreement.

title: LIMIT clause
summary: A clause that  limits the number of results returned by a query and supports an offset to retrieve a specific range of records.

title: LN (or LOG) built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the natural logarithm (base e) of a number

title: LOCATE built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that searches for a string within another string

title: LOG10 built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the base-10 logarithm of a number

title: LONG VARCHAR data type
summary: The LONG VARCHAR type allows storage of character strings with a maximum length of 32,700 characters. It is identical to VARCHAR, except that you cannot specify a maximum length when creating columns of this type.

title: MAX built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL aggregate or window function that evaluates the maximum of an expression over a set of rows

title: MIN built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL aggregate or window function that evaluates the minimum of an expression over a set of rows

title: MINUTE built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the minute part of a value

title: MOD function
summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the modulus of one value divided by another

title: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_MODIFY_PASSWORD built-in system procedure
summary: Built-in system procedure that is called by a user to change that user's own password.

title: MONTH built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the month part of a value

title: MONTH_BETWEEN built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the number of months between two dates

title: MONTHNAME built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the month name from a date expression

title: NATURAL JOIN
summary: Join operation that creates an implicit join clause for you based on the common columns (those with the same name in both tables) in the two tables being joined.

title: NEXT_DAY built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the name of the month in a date expression

title: NEXT VALUE FOR Expression
summary: Describes the NEXT VALUE FOR expression, which retrieves the next value from a sequence generator.

title: NOW built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the current date and time as a TIMESTAMP value

title: NULLIF built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the first argument, or returns NULL if both arguments are equal

title: NUMERIC data type
summary: The  NUMERIC data type provides an exact numeric in which the precision and scale can be arbitrarily sized. You can use NUMERIC and DECIMAL interchangeably.

title: ORDER BY clause
summary: A clause that allows you to specify the order in which rows appear in the result set.

title: OVER clause
summary: A clause used in window functions to define the window on which the function operates. Window functions are permitted only in the SELECT list and the ORDER BY clause of queries.

title: SYSCS_PEEK_AT_SEQUENCE built-in system function
summary: Built-in system function that allows users to observe the current value of a sequence generator without querying a system table

summary: Built-in system procedure that performs a major compaction on a schema.

summary: Built-in system procedure that performs a major compaction on a table.

summary: Built-in SQL function that returns the constant PI.

summary: Pins a table in memory.

summary: Built-in SQL function that computes a random number

summary: Built-in SQL function that computes a random number

summary:
The REAL data type provides 4 bytes of storage for numbers using

summary: Built-in system procedure that refreshes the schema of an external table that has been modified outside of Splice Machine.

summary: Built-in SQL function that determines if a source string matches a regular expression pattern

title: RENAME COLUMN statement
summary: Renames a column in a table.

summary: Renames an index in the current schema.

summary: Renames an existing table in a schema.

summary: Built-in SQL function that replaces all occurrences of a substring in a string

summary: Summary of requirements for installing and running Splice Machine on your cluster or computer.

title: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_RESET_PASSWORD built-in system procedure

title: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_RESTORE_DATABASE built-in system procedure

title: RESULT OFFSET and FETCH FIRST clauses
summary: Clauses that provides a way to skip the N  first rows in a result set before starting to return any  rows and/or to limit the number of rows returned in the result set.

title: REVOKE statement
summary: Revokes privileges for specific user(s) or role(s) to perform actions on database objects.

title: RIGHT OUTER JOIN
summary: Join operation that returns all rows from the right table (table2), with the matching rows in the left table (table1). The result is NULL in the left side when there is no match.

summary: A built-in SQL pseudocolumn that uniquely defines a single row in a database table

summary: Built-in SQL window function normally used to limit the number of rows returned for a query

summary: Built-in system procedure that replaces a jar file in a database.

summary: Built-in system procedure that schedules a full or incremental database backup to run at a specified time daily.

title: SUBSTR built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL function that extracts a portion of a character or bit string

title: SUM built-in SQL function
summary: Built-in SQL aggregate or window function that returns the sum of avalues of an expression over a set of rows

title: SYSALIASES system table
summary: System table that describes the procedures, functions, and user-defined types in the database.

title: SYSBACKUP system table
summary: System table that stores information about each run of a backup job for the database.

title: SYSBACKUPITEMS system table
summary: System table that stores information about the items backed up for each backup job.

title: SYSBACKUPJOBS system table
summary: System table that stores information about each backup job.

title: SYSCHECKS system table
summary: System table that describes the check constraints within the current database.

title: SYSCOLPERMS system table
summary: System table that stores the column permissions that have been granted but not revoked.

title: SYSCOLUMNSTATISTICS system table
summary: System table that describes the statistics collected for a specific table column

title: SYSCOLUMNS system table
summary: System table that describes the columns within all tables in the current database.

title: SYSCONGLOMERATES system table
summary: System table that describes the conglomerates within the current database. A conglomerate is a unit of storage that is either a table or an index.

title: SYSCONSTRAINTS system table
summary: System table that describes the information common to all types of constraints within the current database.

title: SYSDEPENDS system table
summary: System table that stores the dependency relationships between persistent objects in the database.

title: SYSFILES system table
summary: System table that describes jar files stored in the database.

title: SYSFOREIGNKEYS system table
summary: System table that describes the information specific to foreign key constraints in the current database.

title: SYSKEYS system table
summary: System table that describes the specific information for primary key and unique constraints within the current database.

title: SYSPERMS system table
summary: System table that describes the usage permissions for sequence generators and user-defined types.

title: SYSROLES system table
summary: System table that stores the roles in the database.

title: SYSROUTINEPERMS system table
summary: System table that stores the permissions that have been granted to routines.

title: SYSSCHEMAS system table
summary: System table that describes the schemas within the current database.

title: SYSSEQUENCES system table
summary: System table that describes the sequence generators in the database.

title: SYSSTATEMENTS system table
summary: System table that describes the prepared statements in the database.

title: SYSTABLEPERMS system table
summary: System table that stores the table permissions that have granted but not revoked.

title: SYSTABLESTATISTICS system table
summary: System table that describes the statistics collected for a specific table

title: SYSTABLES system table
summary: System table that describes the tables and views within the current database.

title: SYSTRIGGERS system table
summary: System table that describes the database's triggers.

title: SYSUSERS system table
summary: System table that stores user credentials when NATIVE authentication is enabled.

title: SYSVIEWS system table
summary: System table that describes the view definitions within the current database.

title: Scroll layout
summary: This page demonstrates how you the integration of a script called ScrollTo, which is used here to link definitions of a JSON code sample to a list of definitions for that particular term. The scenario here is that the JSON blocks are really long, with extensive nesting and subnesting, which makes it difficult for tables below the JSON to adequately explain the term in a usable way.
